title: Michal Kordula
text:
Michal Kordula (born 11 February 1978) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager and former player.
Kordula started his career in <a href="Ban%C3%ADk%20Rat%C3%AD%C5%A1kovice">Baník Ratíškovice</a>. Later, he and was transferred to <a href="FK%20Jablonec%2097">FK Jablonec 97</a>. Here, he played for seven seasons before moving to <a href="Austria">Austria</a> to play for <a href="FC%20K%C3%A4rnten">FC Kärnten</a>. He then played for <a href="1.%20FC%20Slov%C3%A1cko">1. FC Slovácko</a> (2009–2013). In September 2017 he was announced as the new manager of Slovácko, replacing <a href="Stanislav%20Lev%C3%BD">Stanislav Levý</a>, who was promoted to the position of <a href="director%20of%20football">director of football</a>.
